recipes.name: Tony's Gabagool Sandwich
recipes.description: A classic Italian-American sandwich featuring capicola (gabagool), provolone, and roasted peppers on crusty Italian bread. This is Tony's go-to lunch at Satriale's Pork Store.
ingredients: 1 Italian sub roll or ciabatta bread
instructions: Slice the bread lengthwise and drizzle with olive oil and a splash of red wine vinegar.
Layer the capicola on the bottom half of the bread.
Add the provolone cheese slices on top of the meat.
Add roasted red peppers, lettuce, and tomato slices.
Sprinkle with dried oregano to taste.
Close the sandwich and press down gently to compress the layers.
Serve immediately or wrap tightly for later.

recipes.name: Carmela's Ziti
recipes.description: Carmela's famous baked ziti is a staple at Soprano family gatherings. This rich, cheesy pasta dish is comfort food at its finest.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cook ziti according to package directions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
In a large bowl, combine ricotta, eggs, half the mozzarella, half the Parmesan, salt, and pepper.
In a separate pan, heat olive oil and sauté garlic until fragrant. Add marinara sauce and simmer for 10 minutes.
Mix the cooked ziti with the ricotta mixture and half the marinara sauce.
Spread half the ziti mixture in a greased 9x13 baking dish.
Pour remaining marinara sauce over the top, then sprinkle with remaining mozzarella and Parmesan.
Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Remove foil and bake an additional 15 minutes until cheese is golden and bubbly.
Let stand 10 minutes before serving. Garnish with fresh basil.

recipes.name: Paulie's Peppers and Eggs
recipes.description: A simple Italian dish that Paulie Walnuts swears by. Bell peppers and scrambled eggs make a surprisingly satisfying meal that's perfect for breakfast, lunch, or dinner.
ingredients: 4 large bell peppers (red, green, or mixed)
instructions: Slice peppers into strips, removing seeds and membranes.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add sliced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add pepper strips, season with salt and pepper, and cook until soft and slightly caramelized, about 15-20 minutes.
Beat eggs in a bowl with a pinch of salt.
Pour eggs over the peppers in the skillet.
Scramble the eggs with the peppers until cooked to your liking.
Sprinkle with Pecorino Romano and fresh parsley. Serve with crusty Italian bread.
